issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: The described issue is not actually a problem - it is as designed.
resolution.name: Not A Problem

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

components.name: storm-core
components.description: Core storm daemons and APIs including trident

fields.description:
Hello,
I run 3 topologies inside my cluster.
Sometimes, when I kill one of them (not one specific). One supervisor goes down and restart. After few restart, it become stable.
The topology process is in "Zombie state" in the process list.

In version 0.9.3, all the supervisors crashed and couldn't restart. To resolve this, I had to "rm -fr <storm-local-dir>/workers/"
So I migrate to 0.9.4 (I thought that was STORM-682).

Now it continues but no all the times, but occasionally.

I have these logs inside supervisor.log:

fields.summary: My supervisor crashes when I kill a topology
fields.environment:
I have a test cluster of 3 servers base on Debian.
Each server use a docker running storm inside.

2 servers are only supervisor.
1 server is nimbus+UI+supervisor.

I use Oracle JVM 8u45.

comments.body:
Hello,
Yes I finally found the problem.
kill was the built-in inside bash. After installing procps package it works like a charm!

Sorry for the noise. You can close the ticket or check in the pre-require that kill exists ;-)

Damien
